Description: Shoulder sherd of Aeolian Black Polychrome pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe or amphora; fine orange clay with much gold mica; exterior glazed; below junction of neck and shoulder, frieze of incised tongues alternating added white, added red, black; below, series of added red and white bands.
Curator's comments: The fabric of this sherd is almost identical to 1888,0601.573b-c, which according to NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen (Bonn) falls into chemical group G and hence originated from the region of Aeolis, probably Kyme or Larisa: see Kerschner 2006.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.61)
